org.platanios.learn.combination.error

Class DependencyObjectiveFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.classification.reflect.perception.DependencyObjectiveFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObjectiveFunction

    public class DependencyObjectiveFunction
extends java.lang.Object
implements ObjectiveFunction
    An implementation of an objective function that quantifies the dependencies between the error rates of the different functions. The goal of the optimization procedure using this objective function is to minimize it, subject to some equality and some inequality constraints, and obtain an estimate for the error rates.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ErrorRatesPowerSetVector errorRates
      The error rates structure used for all calculations (this structure contains the power set indexing information used to index the error rates over all possible power sets of functions as a simple one-dimensional array).
      private int[][] hessianIndexKeyMapping
      A mapping used for specifying the sparse format of the Lagrangian Hessian matrix.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DependencyObjectiveFunction(ErrorRatesPowerSetVector errorRates, int[][] hessianIndexKeyMapping)
      Initializes all parameters needed for computing the objective function value, its derivatives with respect to its input variables and its Hessian with respect to the input variables.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void computeGradient(double[] optimizationVariables, double[] optimizationObjectiveGradients)
      Computes the first derivatives of the objective function and the constraints at a particular point.
      void computeHessian(double[] optimizationVariables, double[] optimizationHessian)
      Computes the Hessian of the Lagrangian at a particular point.
      void computeObjective(double[] optimizationVariables, double[] optimizationObjective)
      Computes the objective value and the constraints values at a particular point.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • errorRates

        private final ErrorRatesPowerSetVector errorRates
        The error rates structure used for all calculations (this structure contains the power set indexing information used to index the error rates over all possible power sets of functions as a simple one-dimensional array).

      • hessianIndexKeyMapping

        private final int[][] hessianIndexKeyMapping
        A mapping used for specifying the sparse format of the Lagrangian Hessian matrix. More specifically, each entry of the two-dimensional array is equal to the corresponding index of that Hessian entry in the sparse, one-dimensional, representation of the Hessian matrix.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DependencyObjectiveFunction

        public DependencyObjectiveFunction(ErrorRatesPowerSetVector errorRates,
                                   int[][] hessianIndexKeyMapping)
        Initializes all parameters needed for computing the objective function value, its derivatives with respect to its input variables and its Hessian with respect to the input variables.
        Parameters:
        errorRates - The error rates structure used for all calculations (this structure contains the power set indexing information used to index the error rates over all possible power sets of functions as a simple one-dimensional array).
        hessianIndexKeyMapping - A mapping used for specifying the sparse format of the Lagrangian Hessian matrix. More specifically, each entry of the two-dimensional array is equal to the corresponding index of that Hessian entry in the sparse, one-dimensional, representation of the Hessian matrix.

    • Method Detail

      • computeObjective

        public void computeObjective(double[] optimizationVariables,
                             double[] optimizationObjective)
        Computes the objective value and the constraints values at a particular point.
        Specified by:
        computeObjective in interface ObjectiveFunction
        Parameters:
        optimizationVariables - The point in which to evaluate the objective function and the constraints.
        optimizationObjective - The objective value to set for the given point.

      • computeGradient

        public void computeGradient(double[] optimizationVariables,
                            double[] optimizationObjectiveGradients)
        Computes the first derivatives of the objective function and the constraints at a particular point.
        Specified by:
        computeGradient in interface ObjectiveFunction
        Parameters:
        optimizationVariables - The point in which to evaluate the derivatives.
        optimizationObjectiveGradients - The objective function gradients vector to modify.

      • computeHessian

        public void computeHessian(double[] optimizationVariables,
                           double[] optimizationHessian)
        Computes the Hessian of the Lagrangian at a particular point. The constraints in this case are linear and so they do not contribute to the Hessian value.
        Specified by:
        computeHessian in interface ObjectiveFunction
        Parameters:
        optimizationVariables - The point in which to evaluate the Hessian.
        optimizationHessian - The Hessian (in sparse/vector form) to modify.
